# The Mountain Car Problem

## Problem Statement
In this problem, we consider a variant of the classic mountain car problem, where an autonomous agent controls a car to reach the top of a mountain. The classic mountain car problem is a standard reinforcement learning problem used to demonstrate the challenges of navigating a physical system with limited control. In this scenario, an autonomous agent controls a car situated in a 2D environment with hilly terrain. The objective is for the agent to guide the car from its initial position within a valley to a designated target location atop a hill, overcoming the effects of gravity and inertia. Unlike the original problem with a single slope, our environment features multiple slopes of varying steepness, creating a more complex and continuous landscape.
